comments.body: This is outside the scope of what I checked but we probably should get rid of all the other `null`s too unless they are explicitly allowed / handled in the code. Babel uses destructuring to provide a default `envName` (so only `undefined` is handled), and the rest of the code _in babel_ also assumes it will be a `string` once defaulted.

`babel.config.js` can't be written in typescript, but this can still be used through JSDoc; for example:

```js
/** @type {import('@babel/core').ConfigFunction} */
module.exports = api => ({})
```

You can even throw a `// @ts-check` in there. Unfortunately there is no way to enable `strictNullChecks` unless your tsconfig has `allowJs: true`.

Good: `@example` actually highlights whatever comes after it as typescript code, but without the weird rendering it has with markdown code fences.

Bad: the `@` in `@babel/` breaks it in tooltips.

Code | Tooltip
--- | ---
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73085/52902628-deea8b00-3256-11e9-922e-e74871de3ff4.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73085/52902638-fe81b380-3256-11e9-887e-c1bff66104b7.png)

Alternative with code fences (no highlighting in code, the tooltip copies the source code's indent and `*` prefix):

Code | Tooltip
--- | ---
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73085/52902644-11948380-3257-11e9-954a-b46339dfebbb.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73085/52902649-1bb68200-3257-11e9-920f-72634d356544.png)

Shouldn't the `state` parameter for the `pre` and `post` functions be of type `BabelFile`, based on the implementation?
https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/e498bee10f0123bb208baa228ce6417542a2c3c4/packages/babel-core/src/transformation/index.js#L92
Yes, I believe so. Send a PR with it? ðŸ˜€
